title: COVID-19: Get Vaccinated
description: COVID-19 vaccines are safe, effective, free and they can save your life. Schedule your appointment today.
cleaned_text: Yourself From COVID-19: Get Vaccinated & Boosted Vaccines are a safe and effective way to prevent hospitalization and death due to COVID-19. Although the public health emergency (PHE) ended on May 11, 2023, COVID-19 is still with us. Staying up-to-date with vaccines and boosters can help you protect yourself from new strains of COVID-19. An updated COVID-19 vaccine designed to prevent severe illness caused by newer strains of COVID-19 is expected mid-September at pharmacies, providers, and local health departments. We do not yet have all the details about vaccine availability for different people. People should talk to a provider about which shots are recommended for themselves or their children. Always call ahead of appointments to ask about hours, eligibility, and out-of-pocket costs. Read more about COVID-19 vaccines below. Stay Healthy. Stay Up-to-Date. Staying up-to-date on vaccines is a great way to protect yourself and your loved ones from severe illness due to COVID-19. Vaccines are available for people in Alexandria. For information on which vaccine or booster type is recommended based on your age and health condition, see [VDH guidance](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/covid-19-vaccine/#:~:text=Which%20COVID%2D19%20vaccines%20are%20available%20in%20Virginia%3F) or call your healthcare provider. For updates on vaccines and COVID-19, check the [VDH news page](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/covid-19-vaccine). Vaccine Appointments Find local appointments for any vaccine dose (including boosters) using the Virginia Department of Health vaccine appointment search and scheduling tool: Other appointments at providers like pharmacies can be found on [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). Always call ahead of appointments to ask about hours, eligibility, and out-of-pocket costs. If you have an appointment scheduled and need to reschedule or cancel, please contact the provider directly. For general questions, or for scheduling specifically Novavax appointments, please contact the Alexandria Health Department Hotline at 703.746.4988, Monday - Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Paying for COVID-19 Vaccines Updated COVID-19 vaccines for 2023-2024 will be available from pharmacies and providers. Most people will still receive COVID-19 vaccines for free. Always call ahead of appointments to ask about availability and out-of-pocket costs. People with Medicare Part B can get free COVID-19 vaccinations. People with Medicaid can get free COVID-19 vaccinations through September 30, 2024. More information will be shared soon about no- and low-cost vaccine options in Alexandria for people without insurance. COVID-19 Vaccines are Important for Children COVID vaccines and boosters are now recommended as part of routine [childhood vaccine schedules](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/easy-to-read/child-easyread.html), per the CDC Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP). View or share the [Spanish](https://youtu.be/GZ2Or2ZMI6s) and [Amharic](https://youtu.be/5ULyiobmaRc) webinars presented in collaboration with local community leaders and health experts regarding the safety and importance of COVID-19 vaccines for children. Looking for vaccine and booster options for children under 5? Vaccination locations may include the following, please call ahead to check availability: - Alexandria Health Department clinics, listed above. - Your pediatrician's office. - Pharmacies, which can be found on [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/)(pharmacies can vaccinate only children 3 and older at most locations, some full service clinics can vaccinate children under 3). - Red Sea Homecare clinics, which can be found on the [Red Sea website](https://www.redseahomecare.com/covid)and the [VDH search tool](https://vase.vdh.virginia.gov/vdhapps/f?p=vasereg:vaccinationappointments). - Hispanic American Pediatric Associates, located at 5130 Duke Street, Suite 7, Alexandria, VA 22304. Insurance is needed, call for appointment availability: 703.751.2021 How Can I Receive More Information? Feel free to call the AHD hotline at 703.746.4988 from Monday - Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. or use VDH's extensive [COVID-19 resource pages](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/coronavirus/protect-yourself/) which includes recommendations based on age and vaccine type. As always, you can call your doctor or healthcare provider to discuss the best options for vaccination.
